normalized: the streets lined with flashy signs were beginning to get congested as we slipped out from the alleyway.
despite finding the man, it seemed little time had actually passed.
the streets, heading into the night, were starting to become energetic.
a prostitute heading towards an establishment had a salesperson already beginning to sell his product.

name: man
normalized: come, please.
welcome!

name: man
normalized: i am offering ascension to heaven.
how about you, good sir?
even though night had not even set in yet, the salesperson was calling out to men passing by.
and, he wasn't just calling out to ordinary men, but half-brutish monsters as well.

name: asagi
normalized: （i can't believe their job goes that far…）
there were many among the hellbourne that actually preferred human women.
it looked like that was certainly true here.
for a moment, every muscle in my body tensed up.
if i don't get out of public view, i might have to repeat yesterday's events again.

name: sakura
normalized: onee-chan, what's wrong?
sakura walking together with me, came to a halt suddenly and titled her head curiously at me.
i briefly took in my surroundings.

name: asagi
normalized: （…was it my imagination?
there wasn't anything visibly peculiar, it was just something that caught my eye at random from the richly colored signs.

name: asagi
normalized: （what was that just now?
it was instant, but…）
i had a feeling that someone was watching me.
as that strange sensation went through me, my eyes focused on some people talking.

name: sakura
normalized: onee-chan?
are you listening?

name: asagi
normalized: …i'm listening

name: sakura
normalized: what?
did see something?

name: asagi
normalized: …no, it's nothing

name: sakura
normalized: really?

name: asagi
normalized: i thought i had recognized that man over there.
but, i must have mistook him for someone else

name: sakura
normalized: yeah?
if that's the case, i hope you're right
we once again started down the street that was filled with flashy signs.

name: asagi
normalized: （if it were truly my imagination, that's good, but…）
floating an unconcerned look, i sharpened up every sense in my body as i progressed forward.
prostitutes were coming out into the streets as we made our way into the marketplace.

name: asagi
normalized: （…as i thought, someone is here）
sakura, unsurprisingly, hadn't noticed a thing.
it was a very indistinct, alien presence.
i examined my environs carefully, but i did not see anything unusual amidst the customers who had come to the marketplace lined with vegetable stands and the like.

name: asagi
normalized: （where in the hell…）
it was sudden.
sensing something swelling up inside of me, i turned my head on reflex towards a little girl who was standing alone by herself.
the girl did not seem to fit on this harlot infested street.
she smiled at me sweetly as our eyes met.

name: sakura
normalized: onee-chan--
at last, sakura had felt it too.

name: asagi
normalized: be quiet…, and don't move

name: sakura
normalized: yeah…
it seemed as if all doubts about what i had felt had vanished when she had turned to us.
she slipped through the crowds of people and made her way in this direction.
asagi-oneesama, i presume?

name: asagi
normalized: …yes.
you are?
i am saya.
nice to meet you♪
the voice spilling out between her small lips was still that of a young child.

name: asagi
normalized: saya…?

name: asagi
normalized: （i've never heard of that name…）
i searched my memory, but i didn't recognize either the name or the face.

name: saya
normalized: asagi-oneesama, you truly are beautiful.
i had wanted to see you up close like this once

name: asagi
normalized: …eh?

name: saya
normalized: well, see you later♪
giggling, the little girl turned back into the crowds of people.
caught up in how unbelievably innocent the little girl seemed was making me lose precious time in pursing after her.

name: asagi
normalized: shit…, chi
i hurriedly broke off into a run after the little girl.

name: saya
normalized: ufufu…
the little girl glimpsed at me chasing after her from the corner of her eyes.

name: asagi
normalized: （she's quick…）
i slipped through the throngs of people like performing some kind of dance.
and then, for just a mere instant, a passerby obstructed my line of sight.

name: asagi
normalized: ahh…
the little girl had vanished.

name: asagi
normalized: （…i completely lost her, didn't i）
i sensed nothing even remote.
sakura rushed over to me standing still having blundered in my pursuit.

name: sakura
normalized: onee-chan, who was that child?

name: asagi
normalized: i don't know…, but, i felt something sinister about her
it wasn't proof she was my enemy, but it seemed even less likely she was a friend.

name: asagi
normalized: （why did she greet me, i wonder….

name: asagi
normalized: let's hurry, sakura

name: sakura
normalized: yeah--
we turned our gait in the direction where the little girl had vanished.
the sun was already setting in the horizon.
a dusky color of light was soaking the buildings about when we were making our way to our hideout.
we had to hastily make a detour because we had left the marketplace.
with the exception of that little girl, we remained vigilant in making sure no one was following us.

name: sakura
normalized: it doesn't look like anyone is following, does it

name: asagi
normalized: yes…and it doesn't seem as if anyone has discovered us here either, huh
i surveyed the area around the building, but there didn't appear to be any sign of an ambush.
even so, we entered the building stealthily so that no one would be able to see us.
the evening sun shined in from a window in the room.
i immediately turned on my mini-computer as we entered the room.

name: yamamoto
normalized: …asagi?
did something happen?
it established a signal instantly and the chief's face appeared on the screen.

name: asagi
normalized: i'm sorry, chief.
i had to contact you because of a pressing matter

name: yamamoto
normalized: give me a quick summary

name: asagi
normalized: we interrogated one of the ryuumon members and he told us the three missing people were dead

name: asagi
normalized: i can't confirm if that's true or not, but i have no doubt that they are behind it

name: yamamoto
normalized: …is that so?

name: asagi
normalized: and, i wanted to temporarily abort the investigation here and propose a short evacuation to reevaluate our position, but….

name: yamamoto
normalized: that won't be necessary.
i've already sent a person to see you off.
i think he'll be getting in contact with you shortly

name: asagi
normalized: …ehh?

name: yamamoto
normalized: i'm having kurou swing by you.
he's going as far as the bridge and you'll link up with him there and withdraw from the island

name: asagi
normalized: …what's going on?

name: yamamoto
normalized: n?

name: asagi
normalized: what i meant, chief, was you had this planned in advance.
did something happen over there?

name: yamamoto
normalized: yeah…, to tell you the truth, someone from the outside broke into the public security department's main computers….

name: asagi
normalized: broke into!?
are you saying a hacker got into the public security department's computers?

name: yamamoto
normalized: the matter is still being investigated, but it appears that a trojan horse has been planted from the inside
a trojan horse--, a kind of malicious program that is installed by means of email.
it has a close relation with viruses, but differs in that it is installed beforehand and can control other programs.

name: yamamoto
normalized: there's evidence that the hacker used that last night to easily view and make off with a few files

name: asagi
normalized: …we have data inside there, right?

name: yamamoto
normalized: that's right.
we followed the hacker's route all the way overseas and it appears to vanish into the chinese union
the chief's voice reverberated indifferently as sakura watched from behind my back with a look of tension on her face.

name: yamamoto
normalized: we don't know the exact whereabouts because the signal was intercepted.
but, with the rough climate we're in, it had to be a chinese hacker

name: asagi
normalized: …but, you don't have any other evidence, right?

name: yamamoto
normalized: ahh…, there are some data records left, but i know nothing more than that
someone in a large country.
it would be impossible to find the proof needed to track after them.
no, even if there was proof, it's often the case in history that major powers manipulate the facts.
and they could just as easily throw the blame to any number of countries within their empire and make them out to be terrorist supporters.

name: yamamoto
normalized: it's just a guess, but i would say the whole thing was pinned on some governmentally-backed school kids to plant the trojan at their own expense….
there were actually names given to chinese union study groups by political groups, chinese bureaucrats, and chinese schools.

name: yamamoto
normalized: after that, they identified any data they could and sent it over a highly encrypted signal to a chinese union embassy from within their own country

name: yamamoto
normalized: if we assume that it's data concerning our infiltration of tokyo kingdom, i envision that there will be a proportionate reaction

name: asagi
normalized: i don't want to go that far, but that would mean things would get crazy here, right

name: yamamoto
normalized: that's right.
it holds considerable political implications.
for now, it would be wise to to seek a government decision on the matter

name: asagi
normalized: （…a government decision?
i won't be holding my breath for that）
the fact was, this country's diplomacy has weakened considerably from the olden days.

name: yamamoto
normalized: anyway, it's dangerous there.
your hideout was included in the data.
evacuate immediately

name: asagi
normalized: roger that--.
but, it looks like they're just going to miss me

name: asagi
normalized: （10 of them…, no, 12 i wonder…）
my five senses as a taimanin stretched over my environs while feeling the thirst for blood.

name: yamamoto
normalized: yeah.
is that so…, get out of there while you're still alive

name: asagi
normalized: i am--, i'll get in touch with you shortly

name: yamamoto
normalized: all right
cutting the connection to the chief, i quickly punched into the computer.

name: asagi
normalized: （…all because of using this thing）
i typed in the password, confirming startup.
it hadn't been long since we had even infiltrated the island.
it felt a little like running home with my tail between my legs, but there wasn't any question that the situation was becoming vast and we were just two.

name: sakura
normalized: onee-chan--
it seemed that sakura felt the murderous intent around her as well.
the sudden breathless suspense and the look in her eyes.

name: asagi
normalized: （…yes, let's begin）
we nodded together in silence and began to prepare for the fight ahead.
